intro: Echeveria albiflora, commonly known as the Whiteflower Echeveria, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features rosettes of thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
